samples.context: If i watch my diet, i will maintain good health. if i consume excessive junk food, i will become more susceptible to illnesses. we know that either i am committed to watching my diet or i am not prone to illnesses, but it is uncertain which of these statements is true. it is possible that i am only dedicated to maintaining a healthy diet, or alternatively, i may not be prone to illnesses, or even both statements could be true.
samples.question: What would be the most appropriate conclusion based on the given context?

choices.choice_1: Diana will stay healthy or she doesn't eat too much junk food
choices.choice_2: I will stay healthy or i don't eat too much junk food
choices.choice_3: I will stay fat or i eat too much junk food
choices.choice_4: Mark will stay healthy or he doesn't eat too much junk food

samples.context: If i buy groceries, it means i am able to save money, and if i fail to budget properly, i will end up accumulating debt. however, in my current situation, one of the following must be true: either i have bought groceries or i have managed to avoid accumulating debt. it is uncertain which one of these conditions is true, as it could be the case that only one of them is true or both of them are true simultaneously.
samples.question: Based on the context, what conclusion would be deemed most suitable?

choices.choice_1: I often splurge on unnecessary items.
choices.choice_2: My sister is terrible at saving money.
choices.choice_3: My friend John always helps me with my budgeting.
choices.choice_4: I can save money or i budget properly

samples.context: John's health is directly related to his exercise routine. if he exercises regularly, he will maintain good health, but if he neglects regular exercise, he will become more susceptible to illness. it is uncertain which of the following statements is true: either john exercises regularly and therefore avoids being prone to illness, or he does not regularly exercise but manages to stay healthy regardless. the possibility remains that both statements could be true, but it is unknown without further information.
samples.question: In light of the context provided, what conclusion can be considered the most appropriate?

choices.choice_1: John exercises irregularly
choices.choice_2: John exercises occasionally
choices.choice_3: John does not exercise at all
choices.choice_4: He will stay healthy or john exercises regularly

samples.context: I have two options when it comes to transportation: riding my bike every day or driving my car often. if i choose to ride my bike every day, then i will stay fit and healthy. on the other hand, if i drive my car often, i will accumulate more emissions. it is uncertain which option is true for me. it could be that i only ride my bike every day and do not accumulate more emissions, or it could be that i do not ride my bike every day but still do not accumulate more emissions. either way, i must make a decision that benefits my health and the environment.
samples.question: Taking into account the context provided, what conclusion would be most appropriate?

choices.choice_1: My sister Emily stays fit and healthy or she doesn't drive her car often.
choices.choice_2: I stay fit and healthy or I don't drive my car often.
choices.choice_3: My neighbor Jack stays fit and healthy or he doesn't drive his car often.
choices.choice_4: My friend John stays fit and healthy or he doesn't drive his car often.

samples.context: John knows that if he goes to the gym, then he will stay fit, but if he doesn't go to the gym, then he will become unhealthy. in his situation, it is known that either john goes to the gym or he won't become unhealthy, but it is unclear which one is true or if both are true.

choices.choice_2: he will become unhealthy or he stays at home
choices.choice_3: he will become unhealthy or he doesn't go to the gym

samples.context: Sam has a interesting relationship with food. one conditional statement that applies to him is that if he eats junk food, he will feel sick. on the other hand, if he avoids junk food, he will feel energized. we don't have all the information, but we do know that either sam eats junk food or he won't feel energized, or maybe even both. it's unclear whether one or both of these statements are true for sam, but it's fascinating to see how his food choices affect his well-being.
samples.question: Based on the context, what conclusion would be deemed most suitable?

choices.choice_1: Jake will feel sick if he eats junk food.
choices.choice_2: Sam will feel sick or he eats junk food.
choices.choice_3: Sam will feel energized if he avoids junk food.
choices.choice_4: Jane won't feel energized if she doesn't eat junk food.

samples.context: If i eat nutritious food, i will have enough energy, but if i eat unhealthy food, i will feel tired. it is known that either i eat nutritious food or i won't feel tired, but it is uncertain which one is true. it could be the case that only i eat nutritious food, or only i won't feel tired, or both are true.

samples.context: If i take the bus to work, i can save money on transportation costs, while if i choose to drive, i will end up spending more money on gas. it is certain that either i take the bus to work or i don't spend more money on gas, but it remains unknown which one is true. it could be the case that i only take the bus, only avoid spending extra money on gas, or both actions are true simultaneously.

samples.context: If i practice yoga regularly, i will experience better health and well-being. conversely, if i neglect to exercise regularly, i will become more susceptible to illnesses. given the circumstances, it is evident that either i diligently practice yoga or i will not be prone to illness. the specifics regarding which of these scenarios is true remain unknown. it is plausible that i am committed to practicing yoga regularly, or perhaps i am fortunate enough to not be at a higher risk of falling sick. it is also possible that both situations hold true, where i consistently engage in yoga and do not face an increased vulnerability to illnesses.

samples.context: If he drives a car, he will reach his destination, and if he takes public transport, he will be late. we only know that either he drives a car or he won't be late, without knowing which one is true. it could be the case that only he drives a car, or only he won't be late, or both are true.

samples.context: Every day, i make it a habit to read. it is through reading that i gain knowledge. i understand that if i don't read, i won't be able to comprehend the material effectively. however, there is some uncertainty regarding my reading habits and understanding. at least one of the following statements is true: either i read every day, or i am able to understand the material. it is unknown whether both statements are true, or only one of them.

samples.context: Mona's morning routine determines whether she goes for a run or feels tired throughout the day. if mona wakes up early, she always goes for a run, which helps her start her day on a positive note. however, if she doesn't manage to wake up early, she often ends up feeling tired in the morning. there are two possibilities here - either mona wakes up early and doesn't feel tired or she doesn't wake up early but manages to stay energetic. it's unclear which of these possibilities is true. both could be true, or only one of them could be.

samples.context: Jenny loves going to the circus, and it always brings her so much joy. however, today there is a condition for her happiness. if a lion arrives at the circus, jenny will be happy. meanwhile, in the garden, there is a different situation. if a leopard arrives, sam, who lives nearby, will be frightened. now, we are left with some uncertainty. at least one of the following is true: either a lion arrived at the circus or sam is not frightened. it is unclear which one it is, as it could be either (1) the lion arrived and jenny is happy, or (2) sam is not frightened. we cannot determine which scenario is the case, it may be just one, or both could be true.

samples.context: John is a person who values his health and fitness. he believes that if he runs every day, then he will definitely stay in shape. on the other hand, if he doesn't run every day, then he will inevitably gain weight. it is interesting to note that we have knowledge about at least one of two possibilities: (1) john is committed to running every day, or (2) he won't gain weight. however, we do not know for certain which one(s) of these possibilities are true. it could be the case that only (1) is true, or maybe only (2) is true, or perhaps both (1) and (2) are true.
